answerText: Punch up in Piestany[10] This 1972 eight-game series was the first matchup between the Soviet Union team and Canadian NHL all-stars. It featured Paul Henderson's Game 8 series winner on the Soviet goalie Vladislav Tretiak.
heading: Penn-ance |2012 | 01 | 4 | Trash | None | College
subject: Trash
question: Question: Current NHL head disciplinarian Brendan Shanahan said, "the greatest headbutt [he'd] ever seen" was during this game, which was expunged from IIHF records.  [10] Name this event in which turning off the arena lights didn't stop a bench-clearing brawl between the Canadian and Soviet Union World Junior Hockey teams. Both were kicked out of the tournament held in the namesake Czechoslovakian city.
